channel.title: V1.0 on Understanding the 2016 Presidential Election
channel.description: Recent content in V1.0 on Understanding the 2016 Presidential Election

item.title: Overperformance Map
item.description: Where did Trump surpass Romney? Methods To understand what made 2016 different from 2012, we can just subtract. We can approximate the Trump effect as the difference between the 2016 Republicans Presidential vote percentage and the 2012 percentage to see where Trump outperformed Romney (and won while Romney lost). Results For example, in Winnebago, Wisconsin, Romney got 47% of the vote and Trump got 50.5%. This is a +3% Republican shift that flipped the county from blue to red.
